data.title: Getting Here – Portsmouth Comic Con
data.text:
Industrial action is currently planned for 1-3 June. Please check with your operator how this might effect your journey.

South Western Railway – Click here

Southern Railway – Click here

Great Western Railway – Click here

Portsmouth and Southsea is the ideal station for Portsmouth Comic Con 2023, being only a minute walk from the station to the venue. It is only a 15 minutes (approx) walk from Portsmouth Harbour and Fratton train stations respectively as well. These stations are served by South Western Railway, GWR and Southern.

The city is connected through the railway network to towns and cities across the South – and beyond. This means you can catch a direct service to Portsmouth from London, Brighton, Bristol, Cardiff, Southampton, Winchester, Bath and a whole load more.

Keep an eye out for special offers on rail fares running throughout the year, where you can enjoy discounted fares on routes between Portsmouth and heaps of cities.

PARK AND RIDE

The easy, green and reliable way into Portsmouth! Park your car at the site located just off the M275, then hop on the bus to Victoria Park and back for just £4 per day (up to 5 passengers per car). Buses run regularly every 15 minutes and will get you to the Victoria Park, by the city centre, in just 7 minutes. From there, it’s an easy walk to the Guildhall. Visit https://parkandride.portsmouth.gov.uk/

PARKING IN PORTSMOUTH

Isambard Brunel Multi Storey Car Park has 460 spaces and is 200m from Portsmouth Guildhall.

When attending the show you can purchase an ‘exit ticket’ for this car park, either at the point of booking or on the day of the show, at the discounted price of £4.50. Exit tickets can be collected during Box Office opening hours and before the start of a show.

There are a very limited number of on street parking spaces outside the venue.

There are additional carparks situated close to the Portsmouth Guildhall, please see the map below for references

For more information on car parking in Portsmouth please see www.portsmouthcc.gov.uk

Portsmouth is well connected by sea, whether you are travelling from international waters, or from local islands and areas.

ISLE OF WIGHT

You can catch both the passenger or the car ferry to Portsmouth from the Isle of Wight. Head to Wightlink or Hovertravel for the best routes and how to get to us.

GOSPORT

The Gosport ferry operates every 7.5 minutes at peak times and only take 4 minutes to get across to Portsmouth. Check out the best travel routes for your journey on the Gosport Ferry website.

HAYLING ISLAND

The Hayling Ferry runs from Hayling to Eastney and only takes 3 minutes to get to the island. Find out more on the Hayling Ferry website.

OVERSEAS

If you LOVE us that much and are willing to travel overseas to come and see us, then you are in luck. Portsmouth has international ferry ports that travel from the Channel Islands, all the way to Caen and Bilbao. Check out your best bets below:

Brittany Ferries for connections to Caen, Cherbourg, Le Havre, Santander and St Malo.

DFDS Seaways for Newhaven to Dieppe

Condor Ferries for the route to the Channel Islands
